description:
Asagiri Aya is a young girl who has fallen victim to bullies at her school. Looking for a way to escape her troubles, she looks to the internet for distraction, when a mysterious website called "Magical Girl Site" appears. Simply viewing the page is all it takes to hurtle Aya headlong into the deadly world of the Magical Girl Apocalypse. There, it’s fight or die, against a seemingly endless array of savagely adorable, frilly-skirted killing machines, each armed with magical powers and an unquenchable thirst for blood and chaos.

(Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

node.description:
[Website](http://satokentaro.blog.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/310manga)

He began his career in 2008 with a short story called _Kui King Omega_ pre-published in the pages of Akamaru Jump (Shueisha).

He remains extremely helpful to readers; he's very active on the internet (including on Twitter), he loves sharing with his fans, showing them sketches, and answering their questions and requests. He also frequently attends Comiket, where he sells original manga.
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.

[Official Website](https://iris.dive2ent.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/iris-official-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/iris_official_) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/iris.dive2.official) | [Ustream](http://www.ustream.tv/user/dive2iRis)

i☆Ris is an idol group formed by Avex in 2012 under the DIVE II Entertainment label. Its members are also seiyuu.

__Members:__
• [Saki Yamakita](https://anilist.co/staff/117183/Saki-Yamakita) (山北早紀) - Color: Green; (leader)
• [Yuu Serizawa](https://anilist.co/staff/116515/Yuu-Serizawa) (芹澤優) -  Color: Blue
• [Himika Akaneya](https://anilist.co/staff/119203/Himika-Akaneya) (茜屋日海夏) - Color: Purple
• [Yuki Wakai](https://anilist.co/staff/122697/Yuki-Wakai) (若井友希) - Color: Red
• [Miyu Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/119204/Miyu-Kubota) (久保田未夢) - Color: Orange
• [Azuki Shibuya](https://anilist.co/staff/126076/Azuki-Shibuya) (澁谷梓希) - Color: Yellow (announced to graduate on March 31st, 2021.)

[Official Website](https://www.nicole-hise.de/) | [Synchronkartei](https://www.synchronkartei.de/person/hgRKyNOfZ/sprecher) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nicolehise/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nicolehise)

Was born in Fürth, Germany and is currently living in Düsseldorf, Germany. She also voiced roles in non-anime productions.

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
